title: Picture Postcards
description: [MOCK DATA - description invented for prototype] Picture postcards emerged as a popular form of communication in the late 19th century. The Private Mailing Card Act of 1898 allowed independent companies to publish postcards for the first time. By the end of the 19th century, these often decorative cards were highly esteemed and avidly collected.
primarySource: Cabinet reference - see Jefferson R. Burdick Collection at The Met for similar examples
